intro: Antirrhinum murale var. mauritii, commonly known as the Mauritius wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom throughout the year. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its bright, cheerful appearance.
